column1: In The Queen v Appuhamy 60 N.L.R. 313, the Court of Criminal

"It  is  only  when  a  "fact"  has  been  discovered 
in
consequence of information given by an accused person

and  when  a witness  has  given  evidence  to 
that  effect
that  so  much  of such  information  as  relates  distinctly
to  the fact  thereby discovered may be  proved."
